value_definitions: Plant where secondary xylem (true wood) is present only at the base of stems. (synonym, suffrutescent)

label: Detailed woodiness categories
value_definitions: Plant that has a woody rootstock, but non-woody above-ground stems.

label: Detailed woodiness categories
value_definitions: Plant that forms stems considered only "partially woody", generally having lower lignin and cellulose contents and possibly not forming secondary xylem. These are generally short-lived, fast-growing stems. (synonym, green-stem shrub, soft shrub, soft wood)

label: Detailed woodiness categories
value_definitions: Taxa, including monocots and ferns, that produce thick, stiff, robust lignified stems, but do not produce secondary xylem.

label: Detailed woodiness categories
value_definitions: Taxa, including monocots and ferns, that produce thick, stiff, robust lignified inflorescence shoots, but are otherwise non-woody.
